description: Describes which CDF project the extractor will load data into and how to connect to the project.

project.description: Insert the CDF project name into which you want to ingest data.

idp-authentication.description: Insert the credentials for authenticating to CDF using an external identity provider (IdP), such as Microsoft Entra ID (formerly Azure Active Directory).

authority.description: Insert the authority together with `tenant` to authenticate against Azure tenants.s

client-id.description: Enter the service principal client ID from the IdP.

tenant.description: Enter the EbtraID tenant ID. Do not use in combnation with the `token-url` parameter.

token-url.description: Insert the URL to fetch tokens. Do not use in combination with the `tenant` parameter.

secret.description: Enter the service principal client secret from the IdP.

resource.description: Input the resource parameter and token requests.

audience.description: Input the audience parameter and token requests.

scopes.description: Enter the list of scopes requested for the token.

items.description: The scope requested for the token

min-ttl.description: Insert the minimum time in seconds for a token to be valid. If the cached token expires in less than `min-ttl` seconds, the system will refresh the token, even if it's still valid.

path.description: Enter the path to the .pem or .pfx certificate for authentication.

password.description: Enter the password for the key file if it is encrypted.

data-set.description: Enter a data set into which the extractor should write data.

extraction-pipeline.description: Enter the extraction pipeline for remote config and reporting statuses.

host.description: Insert the base URL of the CDF project.

timeout.description: Enter the timeout on requests to CDF in seconds.

external-id-prefix.description: Enter the external ID prefix to identify the documents in CDF. Leave empty for no prefix.

connection.description: This parameter configures the network connection details.

disable-gzip.description: Set to `true` to turn off gzipping of JSON bodies.

status-forcelist.description: Enter the HTTP status codes to retry.

max-retries.description: Enter the HTTP status codes to retry.

max-retries-connect.description: Enter the maximum number of retries on connection errors.

max-retry-backoff.description: Sets a maximum backoff after any request failure. The retry strategy employs exponential backoff.

max-connection-pool-size.description: Sets the maximum number of connections in the SDKâ€™s connection pool.

disable-ssl.description: Set to `true` to turn off SSL verification.

proxies.description: Input the dictionary mapping from protocol to URL.

items.description: Provide protocol as key and value as the corresponding URL.
